description.plain:
Summer Marjani Walker (born April 11, 1996) is an R&B singer and songwriter hailing from Atlanta, Georgia. Walker’s raw, soulful energy explores new melodies providing her instrumentalist input in production.

Summer Walker first got into music with the guitar, which she learned from YouTube tutorials while working as a housekeeper and stripper at Atlanta. She cites Amy Winehouse, Jimi Hendrix and Erykah Badu as her main inspirations.

Summer released her first song, “Session 32,” in April 2018. In July 2018, she signed to LVRN’s (Love Renaissance) management and released her breakout single “Girls Need Love” bringing her major success and the attention of some popular artists: above all of them, Drake, who eventually got involved in the official remix of the song. Walker also released her debut commercial mixtape Last Day of Summer that same year.

In January 2019, Walker released her debut EP, CLEAR, which she then followed up with her platinum-certified debut album Over It on October 4, 2019.

In early 2020, the Atlanta native made several collaborations, including “Secret” with rapper 21 Savage and Khalid’s remix of “Eleven,” before releasing her second EP, Life on Earth, in July 2020.

On November 5, 2021, Summer released her highly anticipated sophomore studio album Still Over It.

Summer Marjani Walker (born April 11, 1996) is an R&B singer and songwriter hailing from Atlanta, Georgia. Walker’s raw, soulful energy explores new melodies providing her instrumentalist input in production.

Summer Walker first got into music with the guitar, which she learned from YouTube tutorials while working as a housekeeper and stripper at Atlanta. She cites Amy Winehouse, Jimi Hendrix and Erykah Badu as her main inspirations.

Summer released her first song, “Session 32,” in April 2018. In July 2018, she signed to LVRN’s (Love Renaissance) management and released her breakout single “Girls Need Love” bringing her major success and the attention of some popular artists: above all of them, Drake, who eventually got involved in the official remix of the song. Walker also released her debut commercial mixtape Last Day of Summer that same year.

In January 2019, Walker released her debut EP, CLEAR, which she then followed up with her platinum-certified debut album Over It on October 4, 2019.

In early 2020, the Atlanta native made several collaborations, including “Secret” with rapper 21 Savage and Khalid’s remix of “Eleven,” before releasing her second EP, Life on Earth, in July 2020.

On November 5, 2021, Summer released her highly anticipated sophomore studio album Still Over It.

songs.title: Girls Need Love

description.plain: “Girls Need Love” is Summer Walker’s breakout hit single. It serves as a confessional, candid vent on the plights facing girls who speak truthfully about the very normal need for affection, love, sex, or any other form.

songs.full_title: I'll Kill You by Summer Walker (Ft. Jhené Aiko)
songs.title: I’ll Kill You

description.plain: “I’ll Kill You,” the 15th track off of Summer Walker’s debut studio album Over it, features singer Jhené Aiko, and is the second collaboration between the two artists. Throughout the song the two singers trade lyrics threatening to hurt any girl who comes near their guy.

songs.full_title: Body by Summer Walker
songs.title: Body

description.plain: Summer claims this is her favorite track! Sampling 702’s hit song from the 90s “Get it together” it’s foggy what Summer wants. She doesn’t really wanna stay, and she really doesn’t wanna go. Walker claims “I been all in my phone, I got options” ; which is super relatable. You ever been looking at a bunch of guys blowing up your phone with hella attention yet you’re stuck on a screen waiting for a guy to reply that left you on read for 3 hours? Yeah me too girl it’s okay! Summer speaks normality into wanting someone who does you wrong and running back no matter what. Sometimes the person you want can be so toxic for you but things like sex, previous feelings, and attachment keeps you in that unstable environment. Syncing the heart, mind, and body is what this track is all about. Sometimes you gotta leave the body and heart out of it and use your mind !
